questionText: For to us a child is born, to us a son is given... And he will be called Wonderful Counselor, Mighty God, Everlasting Father, ___ of Peace.
She will give birth to a son, and you are to give him the name ___, because he will save his people from their sins.
She gave birth to her firstborn, a son. She wrapped him in cloths and placed him in a ___...
Isn’t this the carpenter’s son? Isn’t his mother’s name Mary, and aren’t his brothers James, Joseph, Simon and ___?
When morning came, he called his disciples to him and chose twelve of them, whom he also designated ___.
Jesus went throughout Galilee, teaching... proclaiming the good news... and healing every disease and sickness among the ___.
When Jesus... saw a large crowd, he had compassion on them and healed their ___.
When Jesus landed and saw a large crowd, he had compassion on them, because they were like sheep without a ___...
As evening approached, the disciples came to him and said, 'This is a remote place, and it’s already getting late. Send the crowds away...’
Jesus replied, 'They do not need to go away. You give them something to ___.'
'We have here only five loaves of bread and two ___,' they answered.
'Bring them here to me,' he said.
And he directed the people to sit down on the grass. Taking the five loaves and the two fish and looking up to heaven, he gave thanks and broke the ___...
They all ate and were satisfied, and the disciples picked up twelve basketfuls of broken pieces that were left ___.
The number of those who ate was about five thousand ___, besides women and children.
Taking the five loaves and the two fish and looking up to heaven, he gave thanks and broke the ___...
Jesus then took the loaves, gave thanks, and distributed to those who were seated as much as they ___.
When they had all had enough to eat, he said to his disciples, 'Gather the pieces that are left over. Let nothing be ___.'
After the people saw the sign Jesus performed, they began to say, 'Surely this is the Prophet who is to come into the ___.'
Jesus of Nazareth was a man accredited by God to you by miracles, wonders and ___, which God did among you through him...
